snippet: Nick Zammuto’s new band, Zammuto, played at Glasslands Gallery, augmenting guitars, keyboard, bass and drums with video and computer capabilities.
abstract: Jon Pareles reviews performance by experimental music band Zammuto at Glasslands Gallery. Photo (M)1
lead_paragraph: The previous band on Nick Zammuto's résumé is the Books, and his new one, Zammuto, stays on the cerebral side. It's a four-man band that augments guitars, keyboard, bass and drums with video and computer capabilities. It came to Glasslands Gallery on Monday night with songs from its new album, also called ''Zammuto'' (Temporary Residence), that merge the nimble, the knotty, the philosophical and the pensive, living up to song titles like ''Too Late to Topologize'' and ''Idiom Wind.''

headline.main: Lyrics Expressing Enigmas Over Layers of Sound
